revised_title: Discovery of Processed Pseudogenes in Drosophila Species
tldr: The authors discovered processed pseudogenes of the Adh gene in Drosophila yakuba and Drosophila teissieri species. These pseudogenes lack introns and have a similar structure to the functional Adh genes, suggesting they arose from reverse transcription. The pattern of base substitution in the pseudogenes differs between degenerate and non-degenerate codon positions in their functional paralogs.
